intro: Oxytropis scheludjakovae, commonly known as Scheludjakov's locoweed, is a perennial herb native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often in rocky or sandy soils. It produces small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pink, and it is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
